title: Limits for sequences of extended real numbers
content: Textbooks generally use a single symbol to denote the limit of a sequence of real numbers. But then, three distinct definitions are usually given: one for the case of convergence to a real number, one for the case of limit to ` +oo ` and one for the case of limit to ` -oo `. It turns out that these three definitions can be expressed as the limit w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals. In this section, a relation ` ~~>* ` is defined that captures all three definitions (and can be applied to sequences of extended reals, also), see ~ dfxlim2 .

blocks.name: clsxlim
blocks.content: Extend class notation with convergence relation for limits in the extended real numbers.
blocks.origin: const class clsxlim { ~~>* }

blocks.name: diff.clsxlim.s
diff.clsxlim.c
diff.clsxlim.w
df-xlim
blocks.content: Define the convergence relation for extended real sequences. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimrel
blocks.content: The limit on extended reals is a relation. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimres
blocks.content: A function converges iff its restriction to an upper integers set converges. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimcl
blocks.content: The limit of a sequence of extended real numbers is an extended real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: rexlimddv2
blocks.content: Restricted existential elimination rule of natural deduction. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimclim
blocks.content: Given a sequence of reals, it converges to a real number ` A ` w.r.t. the standard topology on the reals, if and only if it converges to ` A ` w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals (see ~ climreeq ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
} = {
  3bitrd(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), c1))
  a1i(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1)))
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  df-xlim()
  lmss(c0, cfv(cordt, cle), c1, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cr, c3, c2, universe, w0)
  xrtgioo2()
  a1i(w0, wcel(cr, universe))
  reex()
  a1i(w0, wcel(cfv(cordt, cle), ctop))
  letop()
  climreeq(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), c1, c3, c2, w0)
  eqid(cfv(clm, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xlimclim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[~~>*]c1 ↔ c0[~~>]c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c3 → ℝ))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ)
} = {
  3bitrd(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c0[~~>]c1, c0[(~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤))]c1, c0[(~~>t `(topGen ` ran((,))))]c1)
  a1i(w0, (c0[~~>*]c1 ↔ c0[(~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤))]c1))
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, (~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤)))
  df-xlim()
  lmss(c0, (ordTop ` ≤), c1, (topGen ` ran((,))), cr, c3, c2, universe, w0)
  xrtgioo2()
  a1i(w0, ℝ ∈ 𝕌)
  reex()
  a1i(w0, (ordTop ` ≤)∈ Top)
  letop()
  climreeq(c0, (~~>t `(topGen ` ran((,)))), c1, c3, c2, w0)
  eqid((~~>t `(topGen ` ran((,)))))
}

blocks.name: xlimconst
blocks.content: A constant sequence converges to its value, w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimconst(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wfn(c0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cxr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c3)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  sylibr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1))
  eqbrtrd(c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1, cxp(c3, csn(c1)), w0)
  fconst7(s0, c0, c3, c1, cxr, w0)
  mp3an2i(w0, wbr(cxp(c3, csn(c1)), cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1), wcel(cfv(cordt, cle), cfv(ctopon, cxr)), wcel(c1, cxr), wcel(c2, cz))
  letopon()
  lmconst(cfv(cordt, cle), cxr, c1, c2, c3)
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  df-xlim()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xlimconst(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0[~~>*]c1)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0[Fn]c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ*)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c3)→(c0 ` s0)= c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  sylibr(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c0[(~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤))]c1)
  eqbrtrd(c0, (~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤)), c1, (c3 × { c1 }), w0)
  fconst7(s0, c0, c3, c1, cxr, w0)
  mp3an2i(w0, (c3 × { c1 })[(~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤))]c1, (ordTop ` ≤)∈(TopOn ` ℝ*), c1 ∈ ℝ*, c2 ∈ ℤ)
  letopon()
  lmconst((ordTop ` ≤), cxr, c1, c2, c3)
  breqi(c0, clsxlim, c1, (~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤)))
  df-xlim()
}

blocks.name: climxlim
blocks.content: A converging sequence in the reals is a converging sequence in the extended reals. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm climxlim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  xlimclim(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  climrecl(hs0, c1, c3, c2, c0, w0)
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs0), c3, c0, cr, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm climxlim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0[~~>*]c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c3 → ℝ))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0[~~>]c1)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c0[~~>]c1)
  xlimclim(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  climrecl(hs0, c1, c3, c2, c0, w0)
  ffvelrnda(hs0, c3, c0, cr, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: cnrefiisp
blocks.content: A non-real, complex number is an isolated point w.r.t. the union of the reals with any finite set (the extended reals is an example of such a union). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimxrre
blocks.content: If a sequence ranging over the extended reals converges w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers, then there exists an upper set of the integers over which the function is real-valued (the weaker hypothesis ` F e. dom ~~> ` is probably not enough, since in principle we could have ` +oo e. CC ` and ` -oo e. CC ` ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: xlimmnfv
blocks.content: A function converges to minus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) smaller than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: xlimpnfv
blocks.content: A function converges to plus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) larger than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: xlimclim2lem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ xlimclim2 . Here it is additionally assumed that the sequence will eventually become (and stay) real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclim2lem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cxr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c2, wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  r19.29a(s0, c2, w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr))
  3bitrd(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr)), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), clsxlim, c1), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cli, c1))
  xlimres(c0, c1, cv(s0), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr)))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(c0, co(cxr, cpm, cc)))
  fuzxrpmcn(c0, c2, c3, w0)
  xlimclim(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), c1, cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr)))
  ad2antlr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(cv(s0), cz))

  syl2anr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2), wb(wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), cli, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(c0, universe))

blocks.name: xlimclim2
blocks.content: Given a sequence of extended reals, it converges to a real number ` A ` w.r.t. the standard topology on the reals (see ~ climreeq ), if and only if it converges to ` A ` w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals. In order for the first part of the statement to even make sense, the sequence will of course eventually become (and stay) real: showing this, is the key step of the proof. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclim2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
} = {
  impbida(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)), wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  xlimxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wcel(c2, cz))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wcel(c1, cr))
  simpr(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  mpbird(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  climxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(c2, cz))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(c1, cr))
  simpr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xlimclim2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[~~>*]c1 ↔ c0[~~>]c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c3 → ℝ*))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℝ)
} = {
  impbida(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c0[~~>]c1)
  mpbid((w0 ∧ c0[~~>*]c1), c0[~~>]c1, c0[~~>*]c1)
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, (w0 ∧ c0[~~>*]c1))
  xlimxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, (w0 ∧ c0[~~>*]c1))
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c2 ∈ ℤ)
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, (c0 : c3 → ℝ*))
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>*]c1, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  simpr(w0, c0[~~>*]c1)
  mpbird((w0 ∧ c0[~~>]c1), c0[~~>*]c1, c0[~~>]c1)
  xlimclim2lem(hs0, c0, c1, c3, c2, (w0 ∧ c0[~~>]c1))
  climxrre(hs0, c3, c0, c2, c1, (w0 ∧ c0[~~>]c1))
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>]c1, c2 ∈ ℤ)
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>]c1, (c0 : c3 → ℝ*))
  adantr(w0, c0[~~>]c1, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  simpr(w0, c0[~~>]c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ∧ c0[~~>*]c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ∧ c0[~~>]c1))
}

blocks.name: xlimpnfmpt
blocks.content: A function converges to plus infinity if it eventually becomes (and stays) larger than any given real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: climxlim2lem

blocks.name: climxlim2
blocks.content: A sequence of extended reals, converging w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers is a converging sequence w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals. This is non-trivial, because ` +oo ` and ` -oo ` could, in principle, be complex numbers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm climxlim2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
} = {
  r19.29a(hs0, c3, w0, wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc))
  mpbird(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc)), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), clsxlim, c1))
  climxlim2lem(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), c1, cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc)))
  ad2antlr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cz))
  eqid(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))
  adantr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cxr))
  fssresd(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cxr, c3, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wf(c0, c3, cxr))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wss(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c3))
  uzssd3(cv(hs0), c3, c2)
  simpr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc))
  adantr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cli, c1))
  mpbird(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cli, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  syl2anr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wb(wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cli, c1), wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(c0, universe))
  climres(cv(hs0), c0, universe, c1)
  adantr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wf(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cc), wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), clsxlim, c1)))
  xlimres(c0, c1, cv(hs0), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c0, co(cxr, cpm, cc)))
  fuzxrpmcn(c0, c3, c2, w0)
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), cz))
  eluzelz2(cv(hs0), c3, c2)
  climrescn(hs0, c3, c0, c2, w0)
  ffnd(c0, c3, cxr, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, cc), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  fexd(c0, c3, cxr, universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(c3, universe))
  fvexi(c3, cuz, c2)
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, cc), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  climcl(c0, c1)
  breldmg(c0, universe, c1, cc, cli)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm climxlim2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0[~~>*]c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ c3 =(ℤ≥ ` c2)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c3 → ℝ*))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0[~~>]c1)
} = {
  r19.29a(hs0, c3, w0, c0[~~>*]c1, ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ))
  mpbird(((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3)∧((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ)), c0[~~>*]c1, (c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0))[~~>*]c1)
  climxlim2lem((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)), c1, hs0, (ℤ≥ ` hs0), ((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3)∧((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ)))
  ad2antlr(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ), hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  eqid((ℤ≥ ` hs0))
  adantr((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3), ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ), ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℝ*))
  fssresd(c0, (ℤ≥ ` hs0), cxr, c3, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, (c0 : c3 → ℝ*))
  adantl(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, (ℤ≥ ` hs0)⊆ c3)
  uzssd3(hs0, c3, c2)
  simpr((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3), ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ))
  adantr((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3), ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ), (c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0))[~~>]c1)
  mpbird((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3), (c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0))[~~>]c1, c0[~~>]c1)
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, c0[~~>]c1)
  syl2anr(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0))[~~>]c1 ↔ c0[~~>]c1), hs0 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  climres(hs0, c0, universe, c1)
  adantr((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3), ((c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0)):(ℤ≥ ` hs0)→ ℂ), (c0[~~>*]c1 ↔(c0 |`(ℤ≥ ` hs0))[~~>*]c1))
  xlimres(c0, c1, hs0, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c3))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, c0 ∈(ℝ*[p↦]ℂ))
  fuzxrpmcn(c0, c3, c2, w0)
  adantl(w0, hs0 ∈ c3, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzelz2(hs0, c3, c2)
  climrescn(hs0, c3, c0, c2, w0)
  ffnd(c0, c3, cxr, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, c0 ∈ dom(~~>), c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ ℂ, c0[~~>]c1)
  fexd(c0, c3, cxr, universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, c3 ∈ 𝕌)
  fvexi(c3, cuz, c2)
  syl(w0, c1 ∈ ℂ, c0[~~>]c1)
  climcl(c0, c1)
  breldmg(c0, universe, c1, cc, cli)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0[~~>*]c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: dfxlim2v
blocks.content: An alternative definition for the convergence relation in the extended real numbers. This resembles what's found in most textbooks: three distinct definitions for the same symbol (limit of a sequence). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfxlim2v(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2))))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2)))))))))), diffsc(s1, c1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2)))))))))), diffsc(s2, c1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2)))))))))), diffsc(s2, c2))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2)))))))))), diffsw(s1, w0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, clsxlim, c1), w3o(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wceq(c1, cmnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))), wa(wceq(c1, cpnf), wral(s0, cr, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2)))))))))), diffsw(s2, w0))

blocks.name: dfxlim2
blocks.content: An alternative definition for the convergence relation in the extended real numbers. This resembles what's found in most textbooks: three distinct definitions for the same symbol (limit of a sequence). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: climresd

blocks.name: climresdm

  climresd(c0, c1, cfv(cli, c0), cdm(cli), wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c1, cz))
  simpr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))
  breldmd(c0, cli, c2, cfv(cli, cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))), universe, wa(w0, wcel(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), cdm(cli))))
  fvexd(cli, cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(w0, wcel(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), cdm(cli))))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), cdm(cli))), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))), wbr(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), cli, cfv(cli, cres(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))))

thm dmclimxlim(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(clsxlim)))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c1))

} = {

  climliminf(c0, c1, c2, w0)
  releldm(clsxlim, c0, cfv(clsi, c0))
}

blocks.name: xlimuni
blocks.content: An infinite sequence converges to at most one limit (w.r.t. to the standard topology on the extended reals). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimuni(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c2, clsxlim, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c2, clsxlim, c1))
} = {
  lmmo(c0, c1, cfv(cordt, cle), c2, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cfv(cordt, cle), cha))
  xrhaus()
  sylib(w0, wbr(c2, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c0), wbr(c2, clsxlim, c0))
  breqi(c2, clsxlim, c0, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  sylib(w0, wbr(c2, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)), c1), wbr(c2, clsxlim, c1))
  breqi(c2, clsxlim, c1, cfv(clm, cfv(cordt, cle)))
  df-xlim()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xlimuni(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 = c1)

  lmmo(c0, c1, (ordTop ` ≤), c2, w0)
  a1i(w0, (ordTop ` ≤)∈ Haus)
  xrhaus()
  sylib(w0, c2[(~~>t `(ordTop ` ≤))]c0, c2[~~>*]c0)

}

blocks.name: xlimclimdm
blocks.content: A sequence of extended reals that converges to a real w.r.t. the standard topology on the extended reals, also converges w.r.t. to the standard topology on the complex numbers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Apr-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm xlimclimdm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cxr))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cr))
} = {

  climrel()
  mpbid(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c3), wbr(c0, clsxlim, c3))
  xlimclim2(c0, c3, c1, c2, w0)
  releldm(cli, c0, c3)
}

  releldm(cli, c0, c3)
}
